title: Chelsea news: Christian Pulisic describes struggles ahead of hat-trick vs Burnley
text:
Christian Pulisic starred in Chelsea’s win over Burnley (Picture: Getty Images)

Christian Pulisic has admitted that his start to life at Chelsea was ‘definitely hard’ but has seemingly put those struggles behind him by scoring a hat-trick at Burnley on Saturday evening.

The 21-year-old was starting his first Premier League game since August and repaid the faith shown in him by manager Frank Lampard by scoring three times in a 4-2 win over the Clarets.

The American has had a slow start to his career in England, not scoring for the Blues before the trip to Turf Moor, and has explained his difficulties after arriving at Stamford Bridge over the summer.

‘The first few months were definitely hard,’ Pulisic said after the win in Lancashire. ‘I had a few starts earlier in the season and then I fell out a bit and tried to get any minutes that I could and make an impact.

‘The last few weeks I was able to show that again, helping the team coming in especially in the Newcastle game. I think they saw that and gave me a start today.

‘I didn’t think that it was going to happen right away, being a big success and coming into a big club like this, it takes time. So I’m happy with the progress I’ve made so far and I’m going to keep going from here.

‘The team’s been fantastic, they’ve helped me so much, given me so much advice from the more experienced guys and the younger guys who are experiencing similar things so it’s been a really good time for me.’

Pulisic stole the show at Turf Moor (Picture: Getty Images)

It was a fantastic performance from the former Borussia Dortmund whose strikes with left foot, right foot and head completed a perfect hat-trick.

Lampard explained after the match why Pulisic has taken time to bed in, but now he is expecting big things from the forward.

‘He went and played for his country in tournament football over the summer, when I got the job he had one week off and he said he wanted to come back,’ said Lampard.

‘I asked him if he wanted two weeks, but he wanted a week. I had to take that into consideration for him leg-wise and freshness-wise.

‘He played some games early in the season, Callum [Hudson-Odoi]’s come back, Willian’s been playing fantastic, so I will have rotation issues. I’ve just tried to get the best out of him.

‘He’s going to be a big player for us, a big, big player.’
